alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Fayette; Highland; Pike (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 10:11PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN FAYETTE, NORTHEASTERN CLINTON, SOUTHWESTERN PICKAWAY, NORTHWESTERN PIKE, HIGHLAND AND WESTERN ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 1045 PM EDT... At 1010 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Leesburg, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Washington Court House, Hillsboro, Greenfield, Sabina, Leesburg, New Vienna, Marshall, Bloomingburg, Bainbridge, New Holland, Pike Lake, Kincaid Springs, Rocky Fork Point, Highland Holiday, Cynthiana, Staunton, Good Hope, Frankfort, Clarksburg and Highland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM EDT for southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
